intro: Melhania incana, commonly known as the white melon tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit, resembling a melon, is typically fibrous and not commonly consumed by humans. Melhania incana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
